original_table_html:
Type Description Examples
Corporate chain Two or more outlets that are commonly owned and controlled. Corporate chains appear in all types of retailing but they are strongest in department stores, discount stores, food stores, drugstores, and restaurants. Macy’s (department stores), Target (discount stores), Kroger (grocery stores), CVS (drugstores)
Voluntary chain Wholesaler-sponsored group of independent retailers engaged in group buying and merchandising. Independent Grocers Alliance (IGA), Western Auto (auto supply), True Value (hardware)
Retailer cooperative Group of independent retailers who jointly establish a central buying organization and conduct joint promotion efforts. Associated Grocers (groceries), Ace Hardware (hardware)
Franchise organization Contractual association between a franchisor (a manufacturer, wholesaler, or service organization) and franchisees (independent businesspeople who buy the right to own and operate one or more units in the franchise system). McDonald’s, Subway, Pizza Hut, Jiffy Lube, Meineke Mufflers, 7-Eleven
summary_markdown: This table outlines different types of retail organizations, categorized by their ownership and control structures. Corporate chains represent multiple outlets under common ownership, prevalent in sectors like department stores, discount stores, and grocery stores, with examples including Macy's and Target. Voluntary chains are wholesaler-sponsored alliances of independent retailers focused on collective purchasing and merchandising, such as Independent Grocers Alliance (IGA). Retailer cooperatives are similar, comprising independent retailers who jointly manage a central buying organization and promotional activities, exemplified by Associated Grocers and Ace Hardware. Finally, franchise organizations are contractual agreements where independent franchisees acquire the rights to operate units within a larger system, as seen with McDonald's and 7-Eleven. The overarching structure is comparative, differentiating these retail models based on their degree of centralization and independence.
